thread.title: Travel Alert: Dangerous wild animals are attacking tourists at Yellowstone National Park
thread.title_full: Travel Alert: Dangerous wild animals are attacking tourists at Yellowstone National Park

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: Travel Alert: Dangerous wild animals are attacking tourists at Yellowstone National Park
text:
Travel Alert: Dangerous wild animals are attacking tourists at Yellowstone National Park Adv: 
Jul 03, 2015 Adv: 
U.S.Park officials at the Yellowstone National Park want visiting tourists to be careful and stay away from Bison.Bison can sprint three times faster than humans can run and are dangerous wild animals. 
A 68-year-old Georgia woman experienced this first hand. She remained hospitalized Thursday after encountering a bison while hiking Wednesday on Storm Point Trail. 
Bison attacked two more visitors at Yellowstone National Park over the past week, for a total of four attacks in the park so far this season.
